title: Treaty of Verdun
description: The Carolingian Empire is divided into three parts, one of which would eventually become France.

title: Hugh Capet Crowned King
description: Hugh Capet is crowned King of France, beginning the Capetian dynasty that would rule France until the French Revolution.

title: Siege of Orleans Ends
description: Joan of Arc lifts the Siege of Orleans, a turning point in the Hundred Years' War.

title: Francis I Ascends to the Throne
description: Francis I becomes King of France, marking the beginning of the French Renaissance.

title: Storming of the Bastille
description: The Storming of the Bastille marks the beginning of the French Revolution.

title: Coup of 18 Brumaire
description: Napoleon Bonaparte overthrows the French government in a coup, eventually establishing himself as Emperor.

title: Third Republic Proclaimed
description: The fall of Napoleon III during the Franco-Prussian War leads to the proclamation of the Third Republic.

title: Start of World War I
description: France enters World War I against Germany and the Central Powers.

title: Start of World War II
description: France declares war on Germany after the invasion of Poland, marking the start of World War II.

title: Signing of the Treaty of Rome
description: France is one of six countries to sign the Treaty of Rome, establishing the European Economic Community.
